column4: Anyone aware of how to connect to a linksys wireless router from ubuntu?
This has been the brunt of my passed few hours.
I have tried every combination of ndiswrapper.
-> what is the chip used on your client wifi card?
-> you are already connected to the internet as of now
-> Yes, I am, on *this* computer.  This is a desktop.  My laptop has ubuntu on it
-> get another cat 5 cable and attached one end to your laptop and the other end to your linksys router
thanks, but I'd rather not.
-> you'd rather not? why ask her for help?
-> you'd rather not? why ask here* for help?
I'd rather not have a cable running from my laptop to the cable.  I'd like to extend my laptop's use outside the living room.
-> get a longer cable?
from here-on-in it's turtles all the down.
you are both a hoot and a holler.
-> we're having a lil fun yeah?
-> i was teasing you, and remember we were waiting for you to tell us about your wirless
-> you dont like my 1st suggestion of using a cat 5 cable to just try it out first eh? make sure everything is okay, then switch to wireless after?
-> have we ever find out your wifi chip you use on your laptop? internal or usb attached? pcmcia?
-- I believe we did, and it is a Marvell Topdog or Hotdog or something.
-> internal? pcmcia card you plug in? or usb you plug in?
-- it is a wireless card already inside of the laptop, not anything I plug in.
-> was it turned on when you did   sudo lshw -C network?
-- it was.
-> and what was the result?  post it in pastebin please
